intro: Isotrema chrysops, commonly known as the golden leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
